dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hey, have you been, uh, following Shopify at all lately? The e-commerce giant?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hey, have you been, uh, following Shopify at all lately? The e-commerce giant?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh my gosh, yes! I mean, their value just skyrocketed, right? Peaked at like, $75 billion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh my gosh, yes! I mean, their value just skyrocketed, right? Peaked at like, seventy five billion dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Its value peaked at $84 billion last week, briefly making it the most valuable company in Canada, and pushing the net worth of its 39-year-old CEO Tobias Lutke north of $6 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally! And the CEO, Tobias Lutke, is now worth over $4 billion. But there's this *wild* story about one of their earliest investors.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally! And the C E O, Tobias Lutke, is now worth over four billion dollars. But there's this wild story about one of their earliest investors.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...pushing the net worth of its 39-year-old CEO Tobias Lutke north of $6 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Ooh, do tell! Is it like, the one that got away?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ooh, do tell! Is it like, the one that got away?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much! San Francisco-based Sequoia Capital. They put in, like, $6.5 million initially, built up a 30% stake.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much! San Francisco-based Sequoia Capital. They put in, like, six point five million dollars initially, built up a thirty percent stake.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But for one of its earliest investors, San Francisco-based Bessemer Venture Partners, the hype around the company is bittersweet. The firm first invested $5.5 million in the companys initial funding round, and after additional investments built a 26% stake worth $500 million when it went public in 2015.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, 30% is huge for an early VC!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, thirty percent is huge for an early V C!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I know! And when Shopify went public in 2015, that stake was worth $600 million.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know! And when Shopify went public in twenty fifteen, that stake was worth six hundred million dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...and after additional investments built a 26% stake worth $500 million when it went public in 2015.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, that's already a pretty good return, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, that's already a pretty good return, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but here's the kicker: they redistributed *all* their shares back to their partners by the end of 2017.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but here's the kicker: they redistributed all their shares back to their partners by the end of twenty seventeen.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...Bessemer had redistributed all its shares back to its partners by the end of 2018, when the company was worth $15 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So they exited completely? [interrupts] When the company was what, worth more?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So they exited completely? When the company was what, worth more?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! It was worth $12 billion at that point. But today, that *same* stake, uh, would be worth nearly $20 billion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! It was worth twelve billion dollars at that point. But today, that same stake, uh, would be worth nearly twenty billion dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...Bessemer had redistributed all its shares back to its partners by the end of 2018, when the company was worth $15 billion. ... Today Bessemers stake would currently be worth close to $22 billion, the firm says.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, so they left... what, like $15 billion on the table? That's insane!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, so they left... what, like fifteen billion dollars on the table? That's insane!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: By exiting Shopify two years ago, Bessemer left at least $17 billion on the table.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely insane. Alex Ferrara, the Sequoia partner who led the round, he said he couldn't comprehend that they would have *this* massive amount of success.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely insane. Alex Ferrara, the Sequoia partner who led the round, he said he couldn't comprehend that they would have this massive amount of success.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I couldnt comprehend that they would have this massive amount of success at that time, says Alex Ferrara, the Bessemer partner who led Shopifys initial funding round in 2010.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But why, like, why would a firm like Sequoia just bail on such a hot company?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But why, like, why would a firm like Sequoia just bail on such a hot company?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, um, venture capital firms are kind of under pressure to show returns to their investors within, like, six to twelve years. They can't just hold on indefinitely.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, um, venture capital firms are kind of under pressure to show returns to their investors within, like, six to twelve years. They can't just hold on indefinitely.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Venture capital funds are typically under pressure to post returns on investments in private startups over a relatively short period of time, between five and 10 years, says Gornal.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, makes sense. But still, $15 billion! Professor Will Gornal said it's a significant missed opportunity, and, uh, they're probably kicking themselves.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, makes sense. But still, fifteen billion dollars! Professor Will Gornal said it's a significant missed opportunity, and, uh, they're probably kicking themselves.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Even though a global pandemic does not factor into the forecast of most investors, Bessemers stake in Shopify stands out as a significant missed opportunity in venture investing because it is rare that a venture capital firm would have built such a large stake in a hot startup, says Will Gornal, a professor at the University of British Columbias Sauder Business School. Theyre probably kicking themselves.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, I'm sure! Especially with how the pandemic just, you know, accelerated everything for Shopify. All those brick-and-mortar stores forced online.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, I'm sure! Especially with how the pandemic just, you know, accelerated everything for Shopify. All those brick and mortar stores forced online.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the past month, Shopifys share price has doubled after it generated $470 million in revenue in the first quarter, as demand for its online tools has skyrocketed from brick-and-mortar retailers who have been forced online by the COVID-19 pandemic.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So they did get a good return, though, like 70 to 90 times their initial investment. But man, the *potential*!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So they did get a good return, though, like seventy to ninety times their initial investment. But man, the potential!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While Bessemers one-time stake in Shopify might prove a once-in-a-lifetime type tech position, Ferrara says the firm will gladly take its realized returns on the deal: between 80x and 100x its initial investment.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, they said, "we didn't have a crystal ball." But sometimes, you just gotta, uh, hold on a little longer.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, they said, we didn't have a crystal ball. But sometimes, you just gotta, uh, hold on a little longer.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Says the venture capitalist: We didnt have a crystal ball.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Or a *lot* longer, in this case! Wild story.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Or a lot longer, in this case! Wild story.
